Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: colin92
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two separate times as it was close to the airport and Graceland but we also had free nights. The staff was extremely friendly & helpful. Rooms were clean but not spotless as there was the black mold around the bathtub caulking - a big turn off! Light breakfast consisted of rolls, hard boiled eggs, waffles & cereal. The building just needed some maintainance - curb appeal, front desk , stairwells. It was also located by a busy road which quieted down by 8;00 Of the five different Choice hotels we stayed at on this trip I would rate this at the bottom. The last night we were there two young men decided to pull the tires off a car, do something to the steering and play loud music outside our window until around 8:00 when they finally got the car running. I think there could have been a better place to overhaul a car! The other hotels were decorated for fall inside and out while this one just had a few things around the dining area. It was an ok place for 1 or 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: books30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a week traveling in Tenn. as we had a morning flight. We got a very reasonable rate. If you get a low rate,it is all right. Since it's close to the airport, you hear planes ealry in the morning. Breakfast was standard. Near Graceland also. Not the newest Comfort Inn but it was clean,comfortable and staff was nice. The friendly woman at the desk told us about a good BBQ restaurant near Graceland and a singer was performing Friday night. The place was hopping. Sorry I don't remeber the name, we ate in quite a few good BBQ restaurants in Memphis. Btw, the Rendevous , downtown was the best BBQ restaurant I've ever dined in.

Reviews.Title: “Decent a bit more like an EconoLodge than Comfort Inn but Won't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: llee611838
Reviews.Content: We travel for business and stay in hotels 5 months of the year, and so have a lot of points of comparison. This hotel was basically lean and well kept but an older property. If you were to just put me in the room and ask me to guess the brand, I would have said it was an Econolodge. That brand tends to be older, fewer frills and its quality can vary from quite good to very bad. (If this were an Econolodge I would have said it was a good one. As a Confort Inn I would rate it as a bit less than I expect.) The price was good and the check in staff was friendly and helpful. We had a rare day off and asked about a shuttle to Graceland, which they do offer-- Graceland is a couple of blocks away. The shuttle is the same price as parking at the attraction, so it is not much of a benefit. I do not know if they charge to take the shuttle to and from the airport as well. I have one particular pet peeve that will keep me from visiting this hotel again. We have a routine when traveling. We often check in late and work late. In order for my partner to preserve his energy for our tour, I get up early and get breakfast for him and we eat in the room. I also dislike having all the noise of all the people around in the morning. Occasionally we run into a hotel where there is a sign that says "breakfast is to be eaten only in the breakfast room." Usually it is in an Econolodge, not a more upscale brand. In this hotel, as I was pouring coffee, a worker in the breakfast area noticed my tray and said "breakfast is not for your room." When I pay for a room that includes breakfast, I like to be able to eat it. So I make a note never to stay in these properties a second time. This may not be a problem for every traveler, but it is my pet peeve and we have a lot of options.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient accomodation”
Reviews.Author: EMAILLAG
Reviews.Content: Comfort inn and comfort suites are different. Always opt for comfort suites. Complimentary breakfast was disappointing. However this facility was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “not very clean - would not stay again or recommend.”
Reviews.Author: slbuckcts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as it was close to Graceland and like Comfort Inn chain. Although not in the best neighborhood, I felt safe (we were a couple of single ladies). Staff was kind & helpful, but room was not clean. Looks as if it's used heavily by truckers, but for the casual traveler or vacationer, choose something else to be completely comfortable. We had to change sheets out on the bed (stained) and furniture and floor were not at all cleaned well. I would not stay here again or recommend it to my family & friends.

Reviews.Title: “War zone-terrible-did not stay!!”
Reviews.Author: nothappy0629
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the phone-was told must cancel before 4 pm. We did not arrive in Salem until 5pm. When we got to the motel there were people(didn't look too good) hanging about in the chain link fenced yard. It was a neighborhood of abandoned buildings, dirt, crime and generally a place noone would want to stay. We went in, asked to see the room-we went down a dirty hallway and into a room in which the pillows looked like they had been used. The carpet was dirty and the bathroom was poorly outfitted to be a handicap room. We went up front and told the receptionist we would be staying, canceled our reservation for 2 days but were not refunded any money. Not up to any standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and very nice!”
Reviews.Author: CallyEP
Reviews.Content: My Aunt and I were in Memphis to see Graceland, as we frequently do. We usually stay at the Heartbreak Hotel, but decided to save some money and try the Comfort Inn. Beware, that the area of town is not the best, but don't let that spoil the Hotel. Also the hotel is near the Airport, and sometimes it is very loud. Also, the area has a lot of truck places and a lot of truckers stay at the hotel. The hotel lobby was very nice and open. We really liked the nice lobby and the entry way. We arrived at the Hotel around 10AM to make our reservation, and surprising we could already check in. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and everything was in it's place. The room had a small microwave and a small fridge, two double beds, a comfy chair, a 22 inch TV. The bathroom was very clean, and the shower water pressure was awesome! We only had two complaints about the room. The first one was that there was small cob webs hanging from the ceiling trim. The second compliant was that the heater really smelt bad when turned on. The hotel offered a free breakfast, and it looked okay and there was a good variety, but we didn't have time to eat. Over all, this is a clean hotel and the room was very cozy. I will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night!”
Reviews.Author: TVChick16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Comfort Inn & Suites as one of several stopovers on a roadtrip from DC to Dallas. We spent the afternoon at the Pink Palace Museum and the evening on Beale St. and checked into the hotel around 11pm. We liked the location because we wanted to get to Graceland as soon as it opened the next morning and this hotel is only a few minutes away. I used Choice Privileges points so I did not pay anything for the stay. Check-in was speedy. The room was adequate. The king bed was very comfortable. There was a refrigerator and microwave. The sink area was very large and looked brand new. The shower was a little older, and while it worked fine, there are obvioulsy no water restrictors in place because the water pressure was so strong that it was LOUD. Our toilet actually started leaking in the morning and we reported it to the front desk clerk who promptly wrote it up. The only gripe about this hotel is that because of its proximity to the airport, it can get a little loud. I was awakened a couple times because I heard was I thought was loud traffic, but it was actually plane engines firing up at 3am and 4am. I couldn't believe that commercial flights would be taking off from the Memphis airport at that hour, but I later learned that the FedEx headquarters is in Memphis and every shipment goes in and out of Memphis before it gets routed to its final destination... so the planes I heard were FedEx planes. I'm not sure if staying on the opposite side of the hotel would be quieter... we were in room 103. Of course, the planes didn't wake my husband, so I guess it depends on how heavy a sleeper you are. Breakfast was adequate. I love it when hotels have waffle makers. :) We were planning on getting up early to use the fitness room, but we slept longer than we wanted to (too much fun on Beale St.). The machines looked new... there was a treadmill, an elliptical machine and a stationary bike. I would probably stay here again if I was passing through, but I would request a room farther from the highway and the airport noise, if that is even possible.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Richbutnot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night over labor day weekend while meeting up with my in-laws and our son in college. We had three rooms total, which were all good size. The king suite was actually two rooms combined into one. We wanted to stay downtown, but nothing was available in our price range. This hotel is not a bad location, just one block off I-240 and 10 minutes from downtown. I really don't have anything good or bad to say about it. The staff was friendly, the hotel was clean and safe. I would stay again for one night, especially if I had a flight out the next morning, but I don't think I would make it a base for a multi-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: kosborne32571
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Memphis to attend the NCAA basketball tournament and just wanted somewhere that was clean, safe and had easy access to the interstate. This hotel was perfect! The service was awesome-gave us tips on restaurants and then gave us printed directions to get us there. Can't remember when I have been to a hotel where everyone was so friendly & helpful. The free breakfast was great also. Just a great value overall and if we ever get to Memphis again, will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Clean Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: 1-4travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the airport and about two miles from Graceland. The property is very much need of a renovation but our room was spotless, very comfortable and otherwise met all our expectations. The staff was exceptionally friendly, helpful and welcoming. We would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Inn Close to Graceland”
Reviews.Author: ESCAPETOMD
Reviews.Content: On our last leg of our cross- country trip, we decided to visit Graceland, which we really enjoyed. We didn't realize the area surrounding it was very commercial, almost industrial, and we should have done some research before staying in this hotel. The desk clerk couldn't be nicer. The hotel was busy (lots of truckers) and close to the highway. The hotel had seen better days. The room was small. The bedspreads looked old and we removed them. The desk clerk recommended a Chinese place close by for carry-out. When our food didn't show up after 45 minutes we called them and cancelled our order. Two hours later they showed up anyway (and took $4 off our order). I wonder how long they would have taken if they weren't so close by! The same desk clerk checked us out in the morning. Again, she was very pleasant, but we won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible phone reservation - wrong date - charged - no refund”
Reviews.Author: alitricia
Reviews.Content: I called this hotel on March 11th to make a reservation for March 13th for 2 days for my day off between flights in Memphis. I called stating I was a pilot to get the pilot rate. The representative first would not even believe I was a pilot because I was female and kept mentioning that flight crew (flight attendants) do not get the pilot rate. After 15 minutes of explaining to her I was a pilot, we finally agreed that she would make the reservation for the flight crew price and when I showed my badge that I was a pilot she would give me the extra discount. Then she said that the reservation was made for a two night stay and gave me a confirmation number. I called back on the 13th after my schedule was changed to cancel the reservation, and she stated that there was no reservation for the 13th and that I had no showed on the 11th and been charged the no show fee. I explained to her that I did not make a reservation for the 11th, I called on the 11th making a reservation for the 13th and asked for a refund for the 11th, she continued to insist that I was wrong and had made a reservation for the 11th and would not refund the charge. I am now in the process of disputing the charge with their corporate office and my credit card company. She had been so focussed on accusing me of lying about being a pilot that she didn't pay attention to the dates I wanted and refused to fix her mistake.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing slide in standards”
Reviews.Author: mosambo
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here quite often, due to the value. Cleaning (and sanitary, watch for bugs!) standards have slipped WAY down. The staff is friendly. However, I made a reservation during Elvis Week, and the hotel manager had given away my room when I showed up. They actually told ME when I had made the reservation and WHO had made it (the owner/manager). They had no rooms and since I didn't have my confirmation number handy, they simply said "sorry", buh-bye. That was the last straw. Sam from MO

HotelInfo.Name: Budgetel Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 3005 Millbranch Road, Memphis, TN 38116 (Formerly Comfort Inn & Suites)
